result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daequan Rejosh Stevens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Daequan Rejosh Stevens.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 4: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED. 

Case adjourned for sentencing and restitution hearing in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defense counsel is in trial in another Branch. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Daequan Rejosh Stevens.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, by zoom, defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens not in court, in custody, on a VOP hold.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing, off the record.  State made offer.  Defendant is not prepared to proceed with today's plea/sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant to appear by zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties have not completed negotiations. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25. Plea/Sentencing hearing is scheduled for 7/28/22 at 9:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (17 pages) commencing 5-31-2022 by Georgene L. Littlefair.

Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 16CF2153. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Orozco.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
  
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Lakyshia L. R.,and her residence.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daequan Rejosh Stevens in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daequan Rejosh Stevens appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
